original: Lublin, Henrik Moritz, major, Jönköping, f. 24/8/01 i Sthlm av dir. Ivan L. o. Hertha Labatt. G. 1. 25 m. Eivor Blomberg; 2. 33 m. Madeleine Valentin. Barn: Lilian f. 37. — Stud:-ex. i Djursholm 21, off :ex. 23, AIHS ak 26-28 o. hk 28-30, art. mätkurs f. off. 28, motorkurs 31, gaskurs 34, battxhefkurs v. ArtSS 36, TOK 36-37, skidkurs 38, divxhefkurs v. ArtSS 43, SS 44. Fänrik v, pos :art :reg. 24, und:löjtn. 26, v. Smål. arméart :reg. 28, löjtn. där s. å., kapt. v. reg. 38, major v. reg. 43. Tjg. v. ArtSS övnrtrupp 31, 32 o. 34, mil. besiktnrman f. motorfordon 35-36, 38-39 o. 44, avdxhef v. AUS 37-40, chef f. stud :batt. 41 o. 42, chef f. art. centr. värnpl:sk. f. fält-o. ljudmätare 42-43, div xhef sed. 43. Hobbies: friluftsliv, filateli samt snickeri o. m’ek. arb. RSO, Idr :m, Skidl:-m. o. Pistolskyttem.
translated: Lublin, Henrik Moritz, major, Jönköping, b. 24/8/01 in Stockholm to director Ivan L. and Hertha Labatt. He married 1. Eivor Blomberg in 1925 for 25 years, and 2. Madeleine Valentin in 1933 for 33 years. Children: Lilian b. 1937. Education: Graduated from Djursholm in 1921, Officer's examination in 1923, AIHS military academy 1926-1928 and reserve officer 1928-1930, artillery measuring course for officers in 1928, motor course in 1931, gas course in 1934, battery commander course at the Artillery Officers' School in 1936, TOK (Tactical Officer Course) 1936-1937, ski course in 1938, division commander course at the Artillery Officers' School in 1943, SS (Swedish Staff Course) in 1944. Promotions: Second lieutenant in the field artillery regiment 1924, Lieutenant in 1926, Lieutenant in the Småland army artillery regiment in 1928, Captain in 1938, Major in 1943. Assignments: Served in the Artillery Officers' School observation unit in 1931, 1932, and 1934, military vehicle inspector in 1935-1936, 1938-1939, and 1944, artillery officer at the AUS (Artillery Officer School) in 1937-1940, battalion commander from 1941 to 1942, chief of the Artillery Central Training School for field and sound measurers from 1942 to 1943, division commander since 1943. Hobbies: Outdoor life, philately, woodworking and mechanical work. Awards: RSO (Order of the Sword), Sports Medal, Skiing Medal, and Pistol Shooting Medal.
